intro: Dichrocephala minima, commonly known as the small-headed daisy, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous annual, reaching a height of about 10–30 centimeters. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, dry fruits known as achenes. Dichrocephala minima is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
